alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 1:28AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Live Oak and west central Bee Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 128 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 7 miles south of Karon, or 10 miles east of George West, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Live Oak and west central Bee Counties. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 52 and 61. US Highway 59 between mile markers 706 and 716. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
